forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 51. West wind 8 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. West wind 6 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
As the sun dips toward the horizon, Downtown San Francisco basks in a cloak of soft light, the remnants of a beautiful day drifting into a cool evening. The skies are mostly clear, allowing for a panoramic view of the city’s iconic skyline, punctuated by the shimmering waters of the bay. Tonight will settle in with a gentle breeze, a whisper of coolness from the west, inviting you to wear something light yet warm—a light jacket or a cozy sweater should suffice as the temperature gracefully slides to around 51 degrees.

The forecast for tomorrow promises sunshine and comfortable warmth, with highs flirting near 66 degrees before cooling down in the afternoon. It is a day designed for quiet adventures—perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero or a relaxed afternoon spent at a café, relishing the serene backdrop of the evolving city landscape. Though no fog looms on the horizon tonight, the marine layer might make a fleeting appearance in the early hours, creating a delightful contrast against the vibrancy of the sun-soaked city as you embrace the charms of one of the most picturesque urban areas on the West Coast.
